instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 backlight
threads.message: good, this macbook was changed 2 times backlight chip lp8550 and after a week it comes back and fails with the same original failure, this is the original video failure. macbook works well and the light goes out, it was already tried with another screen and the problem persists.   [URL]https://www.youtube.com/shorts/20yXILa1XbI[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00165 backlight
threads.message:
Did you check XW7720 bridge?
Be sure BKL_EN/PWM signals are stable.

threads.title: 820-00165 backlight
threads.message: XW7720 there is continuity, BKL_EN/PWM are stable 3.2v

threads.title: 820-00165 backlight
threads.message:
Possibly bad solders.
Heat the chip and gently tap it on top.
Put some good flux...

threads.title: 820-00165 backlight
threads.message: change backlight driver lp8550, and backlight is not working. BKL_EN=0v

threads.title: 820-00165 backlight
threads.message:
Check the resistors which generates BKL_EN signal.
Do you still have image?
